FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd dad detect disable command disables DAD from continuing detection in the case of an IPv6 address conflict.
The undo ipv6 nd dad detect disable command restores the default configuration. The ipv6 nd dad detect disable command disables DAD from continuing detection in the case of an IPv6 address conflict. The undo ipv6 nd dad detect disable command restores the default configuration. By default, DAD continues detection in the case of an IPv6 address conflict. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo ipv6 nd dad detect disable
